intro: Randia xalapensis, commonly known as the Mexican randia, is a shrub native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature. Randia xalapensis is often found in moist, shaded areas and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
